name: MCA
mission: To provide religious, social, and educational services to enable the Muslim community to fulfill its responsibilities and contribute to the betterment o...
zakatClaimEvidence: The Muslim Community Association (MCA) explicitly states, "Submit your Zakah request to the Muslim Community Association." and "MCA's core social service is the collection of Zakat and Sadaqah funds to support people in need...". They also have a dedicated "Zakah Request" section on their website under services and mention that "Zakat Al-Fitr will be collected starting March 9th." Furthermore, they have a "Zakah and Relief committee" chartered to facilitate the distribution of Zakah monies. (Source: https://www.mcabayarea.org/donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: masakin (+5); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 32/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish current reserve levels and a board-approved reserve policy (often 3-12 months for most nonprofits).
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.evidence: Theory of change: BASIC (emerging org baseline)
components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

components.evidence: Board governance: baseline (2 members, emerging org)
components.name: Governance

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 2 members

score_details.score_summary: Muslim Community Association of San Francisco Bay Area shows good alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The Muslim Community Association (MCA) explicitly states, "Submit your Zakah request to the Muslim Community Association." and "MCA's core social service is the collection of Zakat and Sadaqah funds to support people in need...". They also have a dedicated "Zakah Request" section on their website under services and mention that "Zakat Al-Fitr will be collected starting March 9th." Furthermore, they have a "Zakah and Relief committee" chartered to facilitate the distribution of Zakah monies. (Source: https://www.mcabayarea.org/donate/)

all_citations.claim: The organization is identified as the Muslim Community Association of San Francisco Bay Area.
Financial data and organizational structure are reported via tax filings.
The organization provides religious, social, and educational services including a weekend Islamic school.
all_citations.source_name: Donate stock to mca – download file

all_citations.claim: MCA facilitates community betterment through its various social and educational programs.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and accepts donations for Zakah distribution.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a moderate overall score due to its high alignment with donor needs and religious urgency, though its impact score is constrained by limited data on financial directness.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public availability of recent financial efficiency metrics
Transparency regarding specific program outcomes and cost-per-beneficiary data

dimension_explanations.alignment: MCA shows high alignment for Muslim donors as a Zakat-eligible institution addressing urgent religious and cultural needs [5]. Its long-standing presence in the San Francisco Bay Area establishes a significant track record for community support [3][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization's impact is characterized by direct service provision through its weekend school and social service programs [3][4]. However, the impact score remains in the medium range due to a lack of specific data regarding cost-per-beneficiary and third-party verification of program effectiveness [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim Community Association of San Francisco Bay Area serves as a vital hub for religious, social, and educational services for the regional Muslim community.
strengths: Designated as Zakat-eligible for donors fulfilling religious obligations
Provides a wide range of community services including education and social welfare
Offers diverse giving options including stock donations
baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim Community Association of San Francisco Bay Area (MCA) provides comprehensive religious and social services designed to enable the community to fulfill its responsibilities and contribute to society [1][3]. The organization manages diverse programs including Zakah distribution, social services, and a weekend Islamic school to support local families [3][5].
